entry.title: POWERBALL WINNER TO BE ANNOUNCED MONDAY AFTERNOON
entry.summary: April 29, 2024 3:50 a.m. Staff from the Oregon Lottery will make an announcement regarding the winner of the $1.3 billion Powerball jackpot on Monday afternoon. entry.summary: April 29, 2024 3:40 a.m. The Roseburg Community Development Department is encouraging local homeowners and other building owners in or near flood zones to make sure they have sufficient flood insurance and take other steps to protect their properties this spring. entry.title: OSU PROFESSOR TO DISCUSS WILLAMETTE VALLEY TRIBAL HISTORY
entry.summary: April 29, 2024 3: 30 a.m. Roseburg Public Library will offer a presentation from Dr. David Lewis regarding his recent book, “Tribal Histories of the Willamette Valley”, Thursday night at 6:30 p.m. A City release said Dr. Lewis is a recognized researcher, scholar, writer and assistant professor of anthropology and indigenous studies at Oregon State...

entry.title: SUTHERLIN FIRE STILL RECRUITING VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTERS
entry.summary: April 29, 2024 3:20 a.m. The Sutherlin Fire Department is still recruiting volunteer firefighters. Participants have an opportunity to become a state certified firefighter while serving the community. There are many benefits included along with the training and experience that will be received. For more information, go to: www.sutherlinfire.org or call 541-459-1394.

entry.title: Primary election ballots will be sent out May 1
entry.summary: Make sure to check you mailbox, as ballots for the primary election will be sent out May 1.

entry.summary: Connie Benham and her mom are both quilters. They have been for nearly 20 years.

entry.title: Equestrian resort project back on track following settlement, developers say
entry.summary: Plans for a sprawling equestrian resort slated for 2,800 acres near Oakland are back on track, after a two-year legal battle between the individuals buying and selling the property was settled last week.

entry.summary: GREEN — From maxi to wedding to cocktail, dresses of all kinds can be found though Kim Torres’ business, Kimz Klozet’s dress barn.

entry.summary: The Umpqua Small Business Development Center and Umpqua Community College have announced the launch of “Dream It/Do it" summer day camp, designed to inspire the next generation of entrepreneurs in Douglas County.

entry.title: Judge recuses himself from case
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Peter Collins, a former Douglas County Sheriff's Office corrections officer, was scheduled for a plea hearing for his alleged embezzlement at 9:15 a.m. Friday, but Douglas County Circuit Court Judge George Ambrosini had to recuse from the case.

entry.title: PUC SEEKING PUBLIC COMMENT ON UTILITY’S PROPOSED RATE INCREASE

entry.title: 'Sharing the river with others': new ownership at North Umpqua Outfitters
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — Dustin Paul visited the Grand Canyon earlier this year for a 30-day trip. He came back to his Myrtle Creek home, “signed the papers and bought a business” — closing the deal March 15.

entry.title: Douglas County employers add jobs in March
entry.summary: Douglas County’s payroll employment increased by a seasonally adjusted 130 jobs in March after a loss of 40 in February and an increase of 120 in January.

entry.title: Umpqua Stargazer: Jupiter slips out of sight
entry.summary: Say goodbye to the evening planets this month. Jupiter sinks lower into the sunset’s glare each night. Look toward the west-northwest horizon just after sunset to spot Jupiter. Don’t delay your observations because Jupiter will slip out of sight by…

entry.title: Wolf Creek Job Corps will host open house
entry.summary: GLIDE — Wolf Creek Job Corps, at 2010 Opportunity Lane in Glide, will host an open house from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. May 15 to celebrate 60 years of job corps.
